content.title: Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy for Wounds
content.description: Use of hyperbaric oxygen as adjunctive wound therapy

key_concepts.details: Increases tissue oxygen tension, promotes angiogenesis, enhances neutrophil killing
Diabetic foot ulcers, compromised skin grafts/flaps, chronic refractory osteomyelitis
Typically 2.0-2.4 ATA for 90-120 minutes; 20-40 treatments depending on response
Mixed evidence for diabetic foot ulcers; may reduce amputation in select patients

content.clinical_significance: Consider after failed conventional therapy in appropriate candidates

primary_sources: Kranke P et al. Cochrane Database Syst Rev 2015
